notices.credits: Sorry, it appears you are all out of credits. If you'd like to juice-up your credits now, please go here.
Looks like you are getting low on credits. If you'd like to juice-up your credits now, please go here.
Want to juice up your credits? Simply go here.

introduction.title: Welcome!
introduction.body: It looks like you're new to Algorithms.io. Don't worry, we make working with your data easy. Simply follow this wizard to get started. Here is a quick look at the process:

datasource_size.title: Define Your Data Sources
datasource_size.body: Algorithms.io can handle numerous data sources. To start off with, tell us a little about your data:

datasource_web_upload.title: Provide Your Data: Web Upload
datasource_web_upload.body: It appears that your data would be best manipulated by transferring directly. Please extract your data into a CSV or XML file. Next, simply drag the file into this window, or select "Add Data Files".

datasource_transfer_tool.title: Provide Your Data: Use the Transfer Tool
datasource_transfer_tool.body: The transfer tool is designed to send data sets that would be to problematic for web upload. Please select your preferred platform from the list below, download, and then run the tool.

datasource_ODBC.title: Provide Your Data: Use a ODBC Connection
datasource_ODBC.body: We will attempt to access the data directly using an ODBC connection. This may require some technical assistance from your network administrator in order to allow specific firewall rules to grant access rights to your data. If you are unsure how to proceed, please contact customer support.

datasource_complete.title: Congratulations!
datasource_complete.body: Looks like you have successfully created one or more data sources. Next, you can choose from our constantly growing library of algorithms, or create your own.

datasource_edit.title: Editing
datasource_edit.body: Please modify the Data Source properties below and then press save to continue.

intro.title: Add or Modify Algorithms
intro.body: Algorithms.io offers a library of over XXXX predefined algorithms. You can choose from these algorithms, modify them, or create your own. Algorithms may be purchased or available for free. Likewise, you may offer your algorithms for sale or for free. Please note that some algorithms may have special restrictions, such as the inability to view or modify the source, or may not be available to you.

method.expert_text: I know what I'm doing, take me directly to the editor
method.novice_text: I'm new and woud like a tutorial
method.browse_text: I'd like to start by browsing the library
method.skip_text: I'd like to skip the algorithm wizard

tutorial.title: Algorithm Tutorial
tutorial.body: Sorry! We are busy at work coming up with a tutorial, but we aren't quite finished yet. Please bare with us while we finish this section up.

choose_datasource.title: Choose a Data Source to Work With
choose_datasource.body: Please choose a Data Source to work with. Don't worry, your algorithm can work with different Data Sources later, however choosing a Data Source now allows for easy use of data fields in your algorithm.

list.title: Browse Algorithms
list.body: Sorry! We are busy at work coming up with a tutorial, but we aren't quite finished yet. Please bare with us while we finish this section up.

complete.title: Congratulations!
complete.body: Now that you have Data Sources and Algorithms to work with, let's setup your Security Roles. Click continue to get started!

workflow.title: Create a Job: Choose Your Workflow
workflow.body: Select the workflow you wish to run:

properties.title: Create a Job: Describe this Job
properties.body: Enter general information regarding this job below.

Labels.Name: Job Name
Labels.StartDate: Select the date and time to start

notifications.title: Create a Job: Choose How to be Notified
notifications.body: If you wish to be notified when the job has completed, please choose from the following options:

Labels.DashboardNotification: Show the status of this job on the dashboard

Mapper.MapperInstructions: Connect dots from the Source to the Destination. Optionally, apply a transformation Reorder the fields found on the left in an order to match the inputs found on the right. Optionally, apply a transformation to the field.

Properties.Title: Algorithm Properties
Properties.Instructions: Please enter basic information about your algorithm below. Make sure to select a programming language, and a Data Source to test with.

Labels.Title: Title
Labels.inputParamsFromDataSource: Create Input Parameters using the Sample Data Source

InputParams.Title: Modify Input Parameters
InputParams.Instructions: Modify the JSON structure below to define the input parameters.

OutputParams.Title: Modify Output Parameters
OutputParams.Instructions: Modify the JSON structure below to define the output parameters.

Properties.Title: Visualization Properties
Properties.Instructions: Please enter basic information about your visualization below. Make sure to select a Sample Data Source to test with.
